content.description: Climb the right-leaning ramp just right of Doggy Style.

This is the first dihedral encountered as you approach Dog Wall. The route heads up a series of about 5 steep steps with slabs between them and ends in a short chimney through a small roof.  The crux is at the last step before the roof.
content.protection: a couple of small and medium pieces (1/2" - 2")

content.description: The rightmost route on the wall.  Climb up an easy right-leaning flake to the first bolt at 15'.  A short, bouldery crux.

climbs.name: Pleasure Dog (aka It's a Bitch)
climbs.fa: Rick Shull, Tim Fearn & Chris Miller, February 1988

content.description:
Start up Cat Walk and then head up and right on a right-angling ramp to reach the first bolt. Enjoyable moves on good edges head up the vertical face to anchors at the lip.  

  This was the first bolted route at the crag and it originally started directly from the ground with one additional bolt (5 total). 

 Current guidebooks list this route as "It's a Bitch".
content.location: Located on the left side of the wall just right of Cat Walk, making this the second bolted line from the left.

content.description: Climb up past the right side of block down low and power up the gently overhanging face on mostly good holds.Originally bolted on rappel (sans top-roping) with a scant two bolts to make a sporty lead which was then lead without rehearsal. This could be one reason why this and the other climbs on the crag were chopped, as it epitomized the "previewed, runout rappel-bolted route"...some of which was certainly true.Current guidebooks list this as K-9.
content.location: This route lies in the center of the wall, just right of the route Dog Logic (aka Here Kitty, Kitty).

content.description: Climb the right-leaning ramp, passing the starts of Cat Walk and It's a Bitch.  Continue up the ramp and onto the run-out face to finish.  Use anchors of Here Kitty Kitty or walk off left at the top.

climbs.name: Doggy Style
climbs.fa: Scott Brainard, Kekvin Frank, Chris Dabrowski 1998

content.description: Climb the first shallow corner left of Wok the Dog.  Follow the flake and ramp up to a shallow left-facing dihedral to the top.  Walk off left.

climbs.name: Dog Logic (aka Here Kitty, Kitty)
climbs.fa: (TR) Rick Shull, Chris Miller & Tim Fearn, February 1988, FL: Geoff Weigand, February 1988

content.description:
Climbs a vertical to gently overhanging wall on good edges to anchors at the lip of the wall. This was the second bolted line on the wall; it was orinally a toprope problem but soon after bolted.  

 Listed in current guidebooks as Here Kitty, Kitty and rated 5.11c.
content.location: Located in the center of the wall, this is the third bolted line from the left.

content.description: Very crimpy. Crux is getting past the second bolt. Hard clip on the fourth bolt. Look for the hidden hold out right. Pumpy finish.
content.location: 2nd route from the right side of the cliff.

content.description: Start near the left end of a right-leaning ramp system and ascend the vertical face above on classic Red Rock edges to anchors atop the cliff.
content.location: Currently the left-most bolted line on the crag, this sits just left of the route Pleasure Dog (aka It's a Bitch).

content.description:
This wall is popular, because it has moderate routes, one 5.7 and several 10's, 11's and a 12. 

  [Reprinted with permission from Jed Botsford, Climbing Ranger - RRCNCA].
